snippet: Fear of attacks by the extremist group of northern Nigeria has uprooted a half-million children in the past five months, Unicef said in a report released Thursday.
abstract: Unicef reports 500,000 children were displaced over past five months due to fear of Boko Haram; report raises questions over Nigerian prime minister Muhammadu Buhari's assertions of progress against Islamic extremist group's campaign of violence and kidnapping.
lead_paragraph: Fear of attacks by the extremist group of northern Nigeria has uprooted a half-million children in the past five months, Unicef said in a report released Thursday.
